description: This course surveys the history of France since 1815 and considers, across the arc of five
republics, two monarchies, two Napoleonic empires, and one authoritarian regime, what it
means to be French. Organizing themes include the revolutionary tradition and the notion of
republicanism, industrialization's impact on society, the transformation of France in response
to two catastrophic world wars, and contemporary challenges such as austerity and immigration.
Foreign Language Across the Curriculum course available in French.  Offered
